intro: Breea segetum f. lactiflora, commonly known as the milkweed plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its showy, often pink or purple, five-petaled flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its most distinctive feature is the production of milky sap, which is released when the stems or leaves are broken. This species is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environments.
